Context:
The George Brown College offers a Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Certificates and Diplomas (A109) program. This certificate program provides foundational knowledge in mathematics and science for various Health Sciences programs. After completing this program, students can apply to several post-secondary institutions for the following programs: Practical Nursing (S121), Dental Assisting (S113), Orthotics/Prosthetics (S102), Medical Office Administration (S135), and Recreation Management in Gerontology (C152).

Graduates of the A109 program have access to direct pathway options for these programs at George Brown College, but admission is competitive and not guaranteed due to limited seats per intake. This program does not offer a direct pathway to degree programs such as Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BScN). Interested students should apply to the Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Advanced Diplomas and Degrees (A108) for pursuing three-year advanced diplomas or four-year degrees.

Programs and their corresponding codes:
1. Practical Nursing - S121
2. Dental Assisting - S113
3. Orthotic/Prosthetic Technician - S102
4. Office Administration – Health Services - S135
5. Recreation Management in Gerontology - C152
6. Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Advanced Diplomas and Degrees - A108
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Certificates and Diplomas Program A109 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text provides information about a Pathway to Advanced Diplomas and Degrees (A108) program at the college. The following courses are required for this program:

Semester 1:
- BIOL 1051: Biology for Health Sciences I – Diploma Pathway
- CHEM 1021: Chemistry for Health Sciences I – Diploma Pathway
- COMM 1000: Introduction to College Communication
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts
- MATH 1142: Mathematics for Health Sciences I – Diploma Pathway
- PREP 1012: Personal and Professional Development

Semester 2:
- BIOL 1061: Biology for Health Sciences II – Diplora Pathway
- CHEM 1031: Chemistry for Health Sciences II – Diploma Pathway
- COMM 2000: Communicating Across Contexts
- MATH 1152: Mathematics for Health Sciences II – Diploma Pathway
- PREP 1025: Speaking with Confidence
- GNED: General Education Elective

The School of Work and College Preparation provides applicants and students with access to a Pathway Advisor. Students who have been removed from this program due to academic penalties must write an appeal letter if they reapply. The text also includes information about General Education Electives, detailed course outlines, and Program Learning Outcomes for the graduate.

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Examine fundamental biological concepts, processes and systems of the human body
- Examine fundamental concepts, processes and systems of chemistry in relation to health and the human body
- Solve basic numeric problems and interpret data related to health sciences and other science-related fields using mathematical concepts
- Use health sciences and other science-related language and terminology appropriately to communicate clearly, concisely, and correctly
- Prepare a personal strategy and plan for academic, career and professional development in the health sciences or other science-related fields
- Investigate health sciences and science-related questions, problems and evidence using the scientific method.

Context: The A109 Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Certificates and Diplomas program offers a direct pathway to the following programs at George Brown College: Practical Nursing (S121), Dental Assisting, Recreation Management in Gerontology, Fitness and Health Promotion, and Office Administration – Medical. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should use the George Brown College Online Application System. Interested individuals can contact the Pathway Advisor via email at preparation@georgebrown.ca or by telephone at 416-415-5000 x2874 for program and pathways information. The Practical Nursing (S121) program has new admission requirements which include an online video interview for all qualified applicants. For more details about college preparation programs, work preparation programs, and other information, visit the respective pages on the George Brown College website. Potential students can sign up for an information session, book a campus tour, or explore the virtual tour to learn more about the college. The Pre-Health Sciences Pathway to Certificates and Diplomas program is taught at the St. James Campus located at 341 King St. E., Toronto, Ontario. Applicants who are former students wishing to return to the program should contact the Program Assistant via email at Christine.Kissoore@georgebrown.ca. For international students, recruitment representatives can be contacted through a virtual meeting or submission of an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
